questions.question: What piece of code can we insert at the start of a line to comment out our code?
questions.hint: Match any of the characters c, o, or g

questions.question: What will the following script output to the screen, echo “BishBashBosh”
questions.hint: Use a character set to match c, f, or h, followed by 'at'

questions.question: What would this code return?
questions.hint: Include both uppercase and lowercase variations in the set

questions.question: How would you print out the city to the screen?
questions.hint: Match both uppercase and lowercase 'File' and digits from 1 to 9

questions.question: How would you print out the country to the screen?
questions.hint: Use a negative lookahead to exclude '7'

questions.question: How can we get the number of arguments supplied to a script?
questions.hint: Match c, f, h, or r followed by 'at'; include uppercase for 'Cat'

questions.question: How can we get the filename of our current script (aka our first argument)?
questions.hint: Use '?' to indicate an optional 's' at the end

questions.question: How can we get the 4th argument supplied to the script?
questions.hint: Escape the dot in 'cat.xyz' since it's a special character

questions.question: If a script asks us for input, how can we direct our input into a variable called ‘test’ using 'read'?
questions.hint: Use groups and an optional 's' for cats and hats

questions.question: What will the output of 'echo $1 $3' be if the script was run with './script.sh hello hola aloha'?
questions.hint: Exclude n to z by specifying a range within the set

questions.question: What would be the command to print audi to the screen using indexing?
questions.hint: Start the pattern with b or h and end with optional 's'

questions.question: If we wanted to remove tesla from the array how would we do so?
How could we insert a new value called toyota to replace tesla?
questions.hint: Use '*' to match zero or more occurrences of 's'

questions.question: What is the flag to check if we have read access to a file?
questions.hint: Use '+' to match one or more occurrences of 'r'

questions.question: What is the flag to check to see if it's a directory?
questions.hint: Use the pipe '|' to match each filename explicitly
